files.description: Runnable Jupyter notebook that loads the CSV template, applies default segment assumptions and sensitivity toggles, runs drive-cycle proxies, and compares ICE vs conversion vs BEV TCO/energy outcomes with plots and tables.
CSV template for user-editable inputs (vehicle specs, segment selection, scenario toggles, cycle choice, and key financial/operational parameters) that the notebook can ingest directly.
Defines default assumptions by segment (fleet, classic, specialty) and validated schema for merging user overrides with defaults.
Provides preloaded standard drive-cycle proxies (urban/last-mile, mixed, highway) as time-speed profiles plus helper functions to select and resample cycles.
Implements simplified comparative models for ICE vs conversion vs BEV including energy use, battery replacement, financing, and utilization impacts using the configured assumptions and cycles.
Loads, validates, and writes CSV/structured inputs and outputs, including robust parsing of toggles and scenario grids for sensitivity runs.
Generates consistent matplotlib plots and summary tables for notebook use (TCO breakdown, energy cost sensitivity, utilization curves, and cycle comparisons).
Package initializer exposing the public API for assumptions, cycles, IO, and modeling used by the notebook.
Pytest suite that verifies defaults merging, CSV parsing, drive-cycle proxy integrity, and deterministic scenario comparison outputs for ICE vs conversion vs BEV.
Project documentation explaining how to run the notebook, edit the CSV template, choose segments/cycles, and interpret sensitivity toggles and outputs.

missionDescription: Implement a runnable notebook + CSV template in /outputs with (a) default assumptions by segment (fleet, classic, specialty), (b) sensitivity toggles (energy price, utilization, battery replacement, financing), and (c) preloaded standard drive-cycle proxies (urban/last-mile, mixed, highway) so users can compare ICE vs conversion vs BEV.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Turns the business-model work into a quantitative, repeatable decision tool by tying vehicle duty cycle to TCO (CAPEX, energy, maintenance, downtime). This directly supports pricing, fleet ROI justifi...
